greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A240751(n) mod n, where A240751(n) = the smallest k such that in the prime power factorization of k! there exists at least one exponent n.
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[k = 2; While[! MemberQ[FactorInteger[k!][[All, -1]], n], k++]; Mod[k, n], {n, 87}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 24 2017 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = A240751(n)%n \\ (For computation of A240751(n), see A240751)
results.author: _David A. Corneth_, Mar 19 2017
